original: High-throughput screening (HTS) has become increasingly important in life sciences research, particularly as researchers confront complex biological questions involving large datasets. For instance, the Human Genome Project has identified over 21,000 genes, each of which may play a role in cellular functions and diseases. Understanding the interactions among these genes, their functions, and their locations within the genome necessitate
